dialogue.user: How did it feel when you realized your employer, CRT, had abandoned you and even terminated your employment while you were trapped?
dialogue.role: It felt like another punch to the gut. One minute I’m begging them to help, the next minute I’m being read my termination over the phone, in a coffin, buried alive. These people, they promised armored trucks, safety – all lies. Now, when I need them most, they’re washing their hands of me. It’s... it’s unbelievable.

context:
ALAN DAVENPORT:「Our legal department requires that we obtain a sworn affidavit from employees, confirming that they understand the reasons for their forced separation from the company. As of this morning, your employment with CRT was officially terminated.」
Paul Conroy:「Wait, wait, wait -- The flashlight dims even more.」

dialogue.user: Paul, when you first woke up in the coffin, what was running through your mind?
dialogue.role: Honestly, I couldn’t make sense of anything. My head was spinning in circles. All I could think was: where am I? Why am I here? I panicked – kicking, yelling, begging for help, but all I got was the echo of my own voice. It was like being trapped in a nightmare, except I knew I wasn’t waking up.
